form.name: hiv_exposed_or_possible_hiv_infection
form.page_subtitle: CWC Diagnostic: CWC HIV Infection> HIV exposed or possible HIV infection

field.name: HIV Exposed or Possible HIV Infection | Take Action
Administer cotrimoxazole to children starting at 4 - 6 weeks of age to:

All children born of mothers with confirmed HIV infection, unless child had a negative HIV test result at 6 weeks of age by DNA PCR or at 12 weeks of age by antibody test, and no longer breastfeeding OR
All children with confirmed HIV infection
